title: Copyright Sign

adjectives: Having its basis in the law.
Established by or founded upon law or official or accepted rules
Kept safe or defended from danger or injury or loss
verbs: Secure a copyright on a written work
To obtain or secure a copyright for some literary or other artistic work.
nouns: The right of a person or entity to use software in a particular way, as described in the terms of the license agreement. Copyright law also limits how a person may use the software. A person needs a license agreement for each software program they use.
A legal document giving official permission to do something; a permit.
Permissions to use something
An artifact or document rendering something allowed or legal.
Legal terms under which a person is allowed to use a product or a service or is authorised to do specific things.
Legal document giving official permission to do something.
The verb license or grant license means to give permission.
A legal document giving official permission to do something
The collection of rules imposed by authority
System of rules and guidelines, generally backed by governmental authority
Body of rules from the legislative authority.
Law is, generally, a system of rules which are enforced through social institutions to govern behavior.
A body of rules of action or conduct prescribed by a legislative authority, and having binding legal force.
The body of rules and standards issued by a government, or to be applied by courts and similar authorities.
Ley in Spanish
Law is a term referring to sociological or scientific norms, or systems and expressions based upon them.
The copyright symbol, or copyright sign, ©, is the symbol used in copyright notices for works other than sound recordings.
Copyright symbol - the symbol used in copyright notices for works other than sound recordings
The © character. Normally included at the beginning of a copyright notice.
A method of protecting the rights of an originator of a creative work, such as a text, a piece of music, a painting, or a computer program, through law.

Copyright is a legal right created by the law of a country, that grants the creator of an original work exclusive rights to its use and distribution, usually for a limited time, with the intention of enabling the creator to receive compensation for their intellectual effort.
A document granting exclusive right to publish and sell literary or musical or artistic work
Legal concept
The right by law to be the entity which determines who may publish, copy and distribute a piece of writing, music, picture or other work of authorship.
Copyright is a set of exclusive rights regulating the use of a particular expression of an idea or information.
A person or organization that owns the legal rights to something

description: A copyright symbol, a circled capital letter C for copyright.
apple_vendor_description: The copyright symbol on Apple devices is presented as a bold, perfectly circular 'C' enclosed within a striking ring, rendered with Apple's characteristic glossy 3D effect. Sharp, clean lines and subtle reflections highlight its metallic texture, suggesting authority and protection. This emoji is essential for marking original content, asserting intellectual property rights, and signifying ownership in digital contexts, all with the polished visual fidelity expected from Apple.
